darkhistory.physics¶

physics contains useful physics functions as well as constants.

darkhistory.physics.CMB_spec(eng, temp)¶

Returns the CMB spectrum in number of photons/cm^3/eV.

Returns zero if the energy exceeds 500 times the temperature.

Parameters:
  • temp (float) – Temperature of the CMB in eV.
  • eng (float or ndarray) – Energy of the photon in eV.
Returns:

phot_spec_density – Returns the number of photons/cm^3/eV.
Return type:

ndarray
darkhistory.physics.H0 = 2.1802207e-18¶

Hubble parameter today in s^-1.

darkhistory.physics.TCMB(rs)¶

Returns the CMB temperature at a given redshift in eV.

Parameters:rs (float) – Redshift (1+z).
Returns:
Return type:float
darkhistory.physics.YHe = 0.25¶

Helium abundance by mass.

darkhistory.physics.alpha = 0.007297352566354976¶

Fine structure constant.

darkhistory.physics.bohr_rad = 5.291772581084844e-09¶

Bohr radius in cm.

darkhistory.physics.c = 29979245800.0¶

Speed of light in cm/s.

darkhistory.physics.dtdz(rs, H0=2.1802207e-18, omega_m=0.3156, omega_rad=8e-05, omega_lambda=0.6844)¶

Returns dt/dz at a given redshift.

Assumes a flat universe.

Parameters:
  • rs (float) – The redshift of interest.
  • H0 (float) – The Hubble parameter today, default value H0.
  • omega_m (float, optional) – Omega matter today, default value omega_m.
  • omega_rad (float, optional) – Omega radiation today, default value omega_rad.
  • omega_lambda (float, optional) – Omega dark energy today, default value omega_lambda.
Returns:
Return type:

float
darkhistory.physics.ele = 1.60217662e-19¶

Electron charge in C.

darkhistory.physics.ele_compton = 2.4263104541371187e-10¶

Electron Compton wavelength in cm.

darkhistory.physics.ele_rad = 2.8179405753065666e-13¶

Classical electron radius in cm.

darkhistory.physics.get_inj_rate(inj_type, inj_fac)¶

Returns the injection rate function.

Parameters:
  • inj_type ({'sWave', 'decay'}) – The type of injection.
  • inj_fac (float) – The prefactor for the injection rate, consisting of everything other than the redshift dependence.
Returns:

The function takes redshift as an input, and outputs the injection rate.
Return type:

function
darkhistory.physics.h = 0.6727¶

h parameter.

darkhistory.physics.hbar = 6.58211951e-16¶

hbar in eV s.

darkhistory.physics.hubble(rs, H0=2.1802207e-18, omega_m=0.3156, omega_rad=8e-05, omega_lambda=0.6844)¶

Returns the Hubble parameter at a given redshift.

Assumes a flat universe.

Parameters:
  • rs (float) – The redshift of interest.
  • H0 (float) – The Hubble parameter today, default value H0.
  • omega_m (float, optional) – Omega matter today, default value omega_m.
  • omega_rad (float, optional) – Omega radiation today, default value omega_rad.
  • omega_lambda (float, optional) – Omega dark energy today, default value omega_lambda.
Returns:
Return type:

float
darkhistory.physics.kB = 8.6173324e-05¶

Boltzmann constant in eV/K.

darkhistory.physics.lya_eng = 10.204269397500001¶

Lyman alpha transition energy in eV.

darkhistory.physics.lya_freq = 2467381384956776.5¶

Lyman alpha transition frequency in Hz.

darkhistory.physics.me = 510998.9¶

Electron mass in eV.

darkhistory.physics.mp = 938000000.0¶

Proton mass in eV.

darkhistory.physics.nA = 2.0308981043443491e-07¶

Hydrogen and helium number density in cm^-3.

darkhistory.physics.nB = 2.499566897654584e-07¶

Baryon number density in cm^-3.

darkhistory.physics.nH = 1.8746751732409377e-07¶

Atomic hydrogen number density in cm^-3.

darkhistory.physics.nHe = 1.562229311034115e-08¶

Atomic helium number density in cm^-3.

darkhistory.physics.omega_DM = 0.2647365852193587¶

Omega of dark matter today.

darkhistory.physics.omega_baryon = 0.049168522713946¶

Omega of baryons today.

darkhistory.physics.omega_lambda = 0.6844¶

Omega of dark energy today.

darkhistory.physics.omega_m = 0.3156¶

Omega of all matter today.

darkhistory.physics.omega_rad = 8e-05¶

Omega of radiation today.

darkhistory.physics.photo_ion_rate(rs, eng, xH, xe, atom=None)¶

Returns the photoionization rate.

Parameters:
  • rs (float) – Redshift (1+z).
  • eng (ndarray) – Energies to evaluate the cross section.
  • xH (float) – Ionization fraction nH+/nH.
  • xe (float) – Ionization fraction ne/nH = nH+/nH + nHe+/nH.
  • atom ({None,'H0','He0','He1'}, optional) – Determines which photoionization rate is returned. The default value is None, which returns the total rate.
Returns:

ionrate – The ionization rate of the particular species or the total ionization rate.
Return type:

float
darkhistory.physics.photo_ion_xsec(eng, species)¶

Returns the photoionization cross section.

Cross sections for hydrogen, neutral helium and singly-ionized helium are available.

Parameters:
  • eng (ndarray) – Energy to evaluate the cross section at.
  • species ({'H0', 'He0', 'He1'}) – Species of interest.
Returns:

xsec – Cross section in cm^2.
Return type:

ndarray
darkhistory.physics.rho_DM = 1262.3925¶

DM density in eV/cm^3.

darkhistory.physics.rho_baryon = 234.45937499999997¶

Baryon density in eV/cm^3.

darkhistory.physics.rho_crit = 4768.485243374999¶

Critical density of the universe in eV/cm^3.

darkhistory.physics.rydberg = 13.60569253¶

Ionization potential of ground state hydrogen.

darkhistory.physics.stefboltz = 6.418149054771152e+23¶

Stefan-Boltzmann constant in eV^-3 cm^-2 s^2.

darkhistory.physics.tau_sobolev(rs)¶

Returns the Sobolev optical depth.

Parameters:rs (float) – Redshift (1+z).
Returns:
Return type:float
darkhistory.physics.thomson_xsec = 6.652458734e-25¶

Thomson cross section in cm^2.

darkhistory.physics.width_2s1s = 8.23¶

Hydrogen 2s to 1s decay width in s^-1.
